instructions: Incorporate a tablespoon of flour, spices, and chopped parsley. Optionally, add cooked peas and carrots.
Heat a deep skillet with oil.
Pour the mixture into the skillet.
Cook on low heat until it sets.
Carefully flip the maqoud onto a plate, then return it to the skillet to cook the other side on low heat until it is fully set.
notes: Maqoud is a traditional dish from the Tunisian-Djerban Jewish community, often enjoyed as a savory treat. It can be served as a main dish or a side.
